result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Longacre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

With Huber. Sentence credit of 17 days were granted. Consecutive to Count 5 on Case 2015CM000820.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM820

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L Longacre

Filed by defendant.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.The Defendant is sentenced to the following: HUBER: 90 days. (credit 17 days) to begin forthwith. Consecutive to Count 5 in 15CM820 and any other sentence.   COSTS: $243.00 apply cash bail. DNA SURCHARGE: $250.00 apply cash bail.  Balance to be transferred to 15CM820.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentencing hearing at 12-21-2016 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count #2  and #3 is dismissed and read in.  Attorney Martinez requests the court grant huber bailiff status.  The State objects to a bail modification.  The Court denies the request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has recently been charged on 15CM2126 and requesting additional time for negotiations on the other case.  The Court sets the matter for another jury status prior to the trial.  Attorney Martinez requests the Court modify the bail to include Huber bailee status with SCRAM monitoring.  The State objects to the bail motion.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/24/15.
Hearing at 11-24-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has just received a new referral. State had a global resolution on all the cases that will change the offer now.  Defense requests to enter a plea today. Court will pass the matter. Case recalled. State addresses the global offer. OWI 2nd addressed. Defense responds. Defense requests another date to review the new OWI case. Court will adjourn the trial. Court will give another jury status/jury trial date on 15CM813. Cases 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along.  Amended Complaint to be filed on 10/12/1015 in file 15CM820.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/8/15.
Hearing at 10-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a new case - 15CM1752. Parties are going to work out a global offer. Defense requests the trial date be removed and these matters be set for plea sentencing date in two weeks. Court will reschedule 15CM813 to a new jury status/jury trial date and 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along. Defense requests to address bail on all of defendant's files. Court grants request. Defense is requesting huber bailee status on all four files - 15CM813, 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752. State takes no position. Court grants huber bailee status.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 09-16-2015 02:30 pm
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
